content.question: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a wheel is rotating in the counterclockwise (positive) direction. A brake is applied to the wheel, exerting a nonconstant friction force on the wheel. The angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> of the wheel as a function of time for the interval of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> when the brake is applied is represented in the graph. Which of the following graphs could represent the angular speed <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for the wheel during this same interval?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled omega. The curve begins just above the horizontal axis and it initially moves out and to the right horizontally before turning slightly up and to the right and ending above the end of the horizontal axis and to the right of the top of the vertical axis. The curve is concave up.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled omega. The curve begins just above the horizontal axis and it gradually curves to the right through the plane and it ends high above the horizontal axis and to the right of the vertical axis. The curve is concave down.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled omega. The curve begins at the top of the vertical axis and it curves gradually down and to the right through the plane and ends just above the end of the horizontal axis. The curve is concave up.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled omega. The curve begins at the top of the vertical axis and initially, it moves out to the right horizontally and then gradually turns down and to the right and ends just above the horizontal axis. The curve is concave down.
